newsitem.title: USA: Tyson Foods splits stock, ups outstanding shares.
newsitem.headline: Tyson Foods splits stock, ups outstanding shares.

text.p: Poultry producer Tyson Foods Inc. Friday announced a three-for-two stock split and plans to issue 4 million new common shares.

The company also said it has increased the post-split quarterly cash dividend to 2.5 cents per share for Class A common stock from 2 cents. The company previously paid 3 cents per Class A share on a pre-split basis.
The company said it plans to expand its core business into the next century.

"Tyson Foods will be a $10 billion in sales company before the year 2005," it said. "We will accomplish this through a variety of means including internal expansion, adding even more value to our further processed product lines, further acquisitions in our core business and further growth in the international arena."
The company had 145.4 million average shares outstanding as of Sept. 28, 1996.
In the fiscal year ended Sept. 28, Tyson Foods reported sales of $6.4 billion, up from $5.5 billion a year earlier.
The stock split will be effective Feb. 15 and the dividend will be payable March 15 to holders of record on March 1.
Tyson Class A stock was up 25 cents at $32.50 in afternoon trading on Nasdaq.
